casebody.data:
First Department,

January, 1960

(January 5, 1960) The People of the State of New York v. Cleveland Adams.

Motion for leave to appeal as a poor person granted insofar as to permit the appeal to be heard on the original record, without printing the same, and upon typewritten or mimeographed appellant’s points, on condition that the appellant serves one copy of the typewritten or mimeographed appellant’s points upon the District Attorney of New York County and files 6 typewritten or 19 mimeographed copies of appellant’s points, together with the original record, with this court on or before March 29, 1960, with notice of argument for the May 1960 Term of this court, said appeal to be argued or submitted when reached. Anthony F. Marra, Esq. of 100 Centre Street, New York, New York is assigned as counsel for the appellant for the purposes of the appeal. Concur — Botein, P. J., Breitel, McNally, Stevens and Bastow, JJ.
